intro: Caprifolium gratum, commonly known as sweet woodruff, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northwestern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, heart-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its aromatic leaves have been historically used in herbal remedies and as a flavoring agent in beverages. Caprifolium gratum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
